Sequence Information.Peptide Name: P11-6 (BP76 derivative, Lys-rich, Leu-rich; Ile-rich; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, de novo designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (81.82%) toBP100L: 27%; K: 45%; I: 27%.  GRAVY: 0.49; M Wt: 1337.825; Mol formula: C66H128N16O12; molar extinction coeff: 0.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aeurus (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), fungi C. albicans (MIC 3.1 ug/ml), and F. solani (MIC 12.5 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100-200 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:E. coli (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:S. auerus (100-200 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:S. auerus (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:C. albicans (5 mM salt); NaCl-insensitive:F. solani (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:F. solani (5 mM salt).Structure: helical in 50% TFE.Toxicity: HC50 400 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic.  Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Qi X, Zhou C, Li P, Xu W, Cao Y, Ling H, Ning Chen W, Ming Li C, Xu R, Lamrani M, Mu Y, Leong SS, Wook Chang M, Chan-Park MB.2010
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2010 Jul 30;398(3):594-600. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2010.06.131.Pub-Med.
Literature Information.Title: Novel short antibacterial and antifungal peptides with low cytotoxicity: Efficacy and action mechanisms.
